Sentencas: Under operating conditions in the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), metallic interconnect plates form electrically insulating or poor-conducting oxide scales (e.g. Cr2O3, Al2O3) at their surface which increase the contact resistance from one fuel cell membrane to the next.
Titulo: Oxidation behaviour of ferrous alloys used as interconnecting material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to minimize electric losses in a fuel cell stack, the formation of oxide scales on the interconnect surface must either be prevented or the oxide scale formed must have sufficient electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Oxidation behaviour of ferrous alloys used as interconnecting material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the present work, investigations were carried out on the corrosion behaviour of different FeCrAl and FeCrMn alloys, some of which were coated with nickel (Ni).
Titulo: Oxidation behaviour of ferrous alloys used as interconnecting material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Information about ageing of these alloys on the anode side of the fuel cell was obtained by means of contact resistance measurements and scanning electron microscopy.
Titulo: Oxidation behaviour of ferrous alloys used as interconnecting material in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results reveal that FeCrMn(LaTi) alloys and Ni-coated interconnects exhibit low ageing rates and are thus suitable for use on the anode side of SOFCs.
Titulo: Oxidation behaviour of ferrous alloys used as interconnecting material in solid oxide fuel cells
